page.title: 05Connections With Bosworth
page.content: Although the official site of the Battle of Bosworth,at Ambion Hill is outside our allocated area,there are many connections with Bosworth around Dadlington and Stapleton.The people of this area feel very proud of these links,and some are trying to prove that the actual battle took place at Dadlington. Richard's Well,to the NW of Ambion Wood,is supposed to be where Richard III drank during the battle.It is believed that on the eve of the battle he slept in the church at Stapleton,but it is also claimed that he camped near Harpers Hill. Historians believe that Henry Tudor's troops pushed Richard's army as far as the Hinckley Rd,Stoke Golding.Many soldiers are believed to have been buried in the area,especially at Dadlington and Stoke Golding.
